intro: Woehleria, commonly known as the spider orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are native to various regions of Australia, particularly in the southern and western parts of the country. Woehleria species are characterized by their intricate, often showy flowers that resemble spiders, hence their common name. They typically grow in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. The genus includes several species, each with unique floral structures and color variations.
